<<<<<<< HEAD
The young man's duty A discourse shewing the necessity of seeking the Lord betimes; as also the danger and unreasonableness in trusting to a late, or death-bed repentance. Designed especially for young persons, before they are debauched by evil company, and evil habits. By Rich. Kidder M.A. Kidder, Richard, 1633-1703.
[20], 188, [2] p.
printed by H.L. for George Calvert and Samuel Sprint at the Golden Ball in Duck-lane, London : 1671.
With a vertical half-title on verso of p.[20]: The young man's duty. With a final advertisement leaf. Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
=======
The young man's duty A discourse shewing the necessity of seeking the Lord betimes; as also the danger and unreasonableness in trusting to a late, or death-bed repentance. Designed especially for young persons, before they are debauched by evil company, and evil habits. By Rich. Kidder M.A. Kidder, Richard, 1633-1703.
[20], 188, [2] p.
printed by H.L. for George Calvert and Samuel Sprint at the Golden Ball in Duck-lane, London : 1671.
With a vertical half-title on verso of p.[20]: The young man's duty. With a final advertisement leaf. Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
